thread.title: Google may face new antitrust inquiry into Android
thread.title_full: Google may face new antitrust inquiry into Android

title: Google may face new antitrust inquiry into Android
text:
he new Google logo is displayed on a sign outside of the Google headquarters in Mountain View, Calif. (Photo: Justin Sullivan, Getty Images)
1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE SAN FRANCISCO â€” Google may be facing a fresh round of U.S. antitrust scrutiny with regulators looking into whether it's using its Android mobile software to stifle competition.
The Federal Trade Commission has met with technology companies who say Google gives priority to its own services on Android, according to Bloomberg News.
The investigation said to be in its early stages would mirror another probe in the European Union after complaints from a group that represents Microsoft among others.
The FTC and Google could not be immediately reached for comment.
USA TODAY
Google faces trouble abroad
It has been two years since the FTC settled its last investigation with Google over Web search.
Google's Android mobile software is the world's most popular. In the U.S. it accounted for 59% of the market while Apple's iPhone software had 38%, according to research firm International Data Corp.
USA TODAY
Google's EU 'enforcer' on antitrust, Twitter, Daily Show
Google bundles its products, such as search, email and maps, into the software which critics say abuses its market position. The EU is probing whether that practice harms rival applications as well as device manufacturers.
